title: Introduction to Bootstrap 5
content: Bootstrap is a popular front-end framework that simplifies the development of responsive and mobile-first websites and web applications. Originally created by developers at Twitter, Bootstrap offers a comprehensive set of tools, including HTML and CSS-based design templates, along with JavaScript extensions, to facilitate efficient and consistent web design. It provides pre-styled components like buttons, forms, navigation bars, and typography, allowing developers to build aesthetically pleasing and functional interfaces with minimal effort. Bootstrap's grid system enables responsive layout design, ensuring seamless adaptation across various screen sizes and devices. Overall, Bootstrap is widely favored for its ease of use, extensive documentation, and robust community support, making it an indispensable tool for both beginners and experienced developers alike.
code_example: <link href='https://stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/5.1.3/css/bootstrap.min.css' rel='stylesheet'>

title: Container
content: Containers are the most basic layout element in Bootstrap, used to wrap site contents.
code_example: Your content here

title: Grid System
content: The Bootstrap grid system uses a series of containers, rows, and columns to layout and align content.
code_example: Column

title: Typography
content: Bootstrap provides basic styling for typography, including headings, paragraphs, and more.

title: Colors
content: Bootstrap includes a wide range of color utilities for text, backgrounds, and more.

title: Buttons
content: Buttons in Bootstrap are customizable and come in several predefined styles.
code_example: <button class='btn btn-primary'>Primary Button</button>

title: Forms
content: Bootstrap provides a variety of form controls and layout options for creating forms.

title: Alerts
content: Use Bootstrap alerts to provide contextual feedback messages.
code_example: This is a warning alert

title: Cards
content: Cards are a flexible and extensible content container with multiple variants and options.
code_example: This is some text within a card body.

title: Images
content: Bootstrap includes styles for images to make them responsive and properly aligned.

title: Tables
content: Bootstrap provides styling options for tables to make them more appealing.
code_example:

title: Navbar
content: The navbar is a responsive and flexible navigation bar that can include branding, navigation, and more.
code_example: Navbar

title: Modal
content: Modals are streamlined, but flexible dialog prompts with the minimum required functionality and smart defaults.
code_example:
Modal title

content: Toggle contextual overlays for displaying lists of links and more with the Bootstrap dropdown plugin.

title: Pagination
content: Bootstrap offers various options to create pagination controls.
code_example:

  • 1

  • 3
  • Next

title: Tooltips
content: Tooltips provide brief, informative messages that appear when a user interacts with an element.
code_example: <button type='button' class='btn btn-secondary' data-bs-toggle='tooltip' data-bs-placement='top' title='Tooltip on top'>Tooltip on top</button>

title: Spinners
content: Bootstrap spinners can be used to show the loading state in your projects.
code_example: Loading...

title: Carousel
content: Carousels are used to create slideshows for cycling through elements.

title: Collapse
content: Collapse is used to toggle the visibility of content.

title: Accordions
content: Accordions are used to toggle between showing and hiding content.

title: Badges
content: Badges are small count and labeling components.
code_example: PrimarySecondarySuccess

title: Breadcrumb
content: Breadcrumbs are used to indicate the current page’s location within a navigational hierarchy.
code_example:
1. Home
  2. Library
  3. Data

title: List Group
content: List groups are flexible and powerful components for displaying a series of content.
code_example:
• Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Morbi leo risus

title: Media Object
content: The media object helps build complex and repetitive components where some media is positioned alongside content.
code_example:
Media heading
Cras sit amet nibh libero, in gravida nulla. Nulla vel metus scelerisque ante sollicitudin.

title: Progress
content: Progress bars are used to show the progress of a task.

title: Scrollspy
content: Scrollspy allows you to automatically update links in a navigation list based on scroll position.

title: Toasts
content: Toasts are used to show brief alerts or notifications.
code_example:

title: Utilities
content: Bootstrap provides various utility classes for spacing, text alignment, and more.
code_example:
Centered text
Margin top 5

title: Flexbox
content: Bootstrap uses Flexbox for its grid system and various layout utilities.
code_example: Centered content

title: Sass
content: Bootstrap is built with Sass, a CSS preprocessor that adds special features such as variables and nested rules.
code_example: $theme-colors: (primary: #007bff, secondary: #6c757d, success: #28a745, info: #17a2b8, warning: #ffc107, danger: #dc3545, light: #f8f9fa, dark: #343a40);

title: Reboot
content: Reboot is a collection of element-specific CSS changes in Bootstrap.
code_example: html { line-height: 1.15; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; } body { margin: 0; font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', Arial, sans-serif, 'Apple Color Emoji', 'Segoe UI Emoji', 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 1rem; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.5; color: #212529; text-align: left; background-color: #fff; }

title: Icons
content: Bootstrap Icons are an extensive library of icons that can be used with Bootstrap projects.

title: RTL Support
content: Bootstrap 5 includes built-in support for right-to-left (RTL) languages.
code_example: <html dir='rtl'><head><link href='bootstrap-rtl.min.css' rel='stylesheet'></head><body>...</body></html>

title: Spinner
content: Spinners can be used to show the loading state in your projects.

title: Utilities: Borders
content: Bootstrap provides utility classes for adding borders to elements.

title: Utilities: Shadows
content: Utility classes for adding shadows to elements are available in Bootstrap.
